intro: Strychnos longicaudata var. niamniamensis, commonly known as the Niamniam tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Central Africa. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by woody capsules containing elliptical seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical rainforests and is valued for its medicinal properties.
